description: A collection of circles in a thick angular line-shaped formation, bent at a roughly 120-degree angle. Each circle has a different number in the center denoting how many lines stem from that point. There's a very small yellowish-orange triangle to the left of the center of the formation and a gray-blue triangle below the center.

author.name: VertexArchive
author.description: An UNOFFICIAL archive of the New York Times' Vertex puzzle. This account is not affiliated with the NY Times. I just like the triangles.
